alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 11:47AM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau affecting Bienville, Webster, Red River and Bossier Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 143.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Louisiana 164. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 142.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Tuesday was 142.7 feet. - Forecast...The lake is expected to rise to 143 feet by Thursday - Flood stage is 142.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 142.9 feet on 01/08/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1200 PM CST.
